ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The shrubs and the trees all bow down in prostration.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And the grasses and the trees bow (to Him) in adoration.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and the stars and the trees all prostrate themselves,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The plants and trees prostrate before Him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the plants and the trees prostrate (for Him).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And the Najm and the trees prostrating.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the herbs and the trees do prostrate (to Him).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and the stars and the trees bow themselves;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The stars and the trees prostrate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: the stars and the trees bend in prostration.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And the herbs and the trees do obe isance."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and the herb and the tree prostrate [to Allah].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And the herbs and the trees - both (alike) prostrate in adoration.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And the herbs (or stars) and the trees both prostrate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The stars and the trees prostrate themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the stars and the trees prostrate themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the stars and trees prostrate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [55:6] and the grass, all stalkless vegetation, and the trees, that [vegetation] which possesses stalk, prostrate, comply with what is required of them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The najm and the trees adore) the stars and the trees prostrate to the Beneficent; and it is also said that najm refers to vegetation that has no stalks.
